***** Hindi[edit] *****
**** Etymology[edit] ****
Inherited from Sanskrit рдХрд▓реНрдп (kalya).
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * (Delhi Hindi) IPA(key): /k╔Щl/, [k╔Щl╠к]
    * Rhymes: -╔Щl
**** Adverb[edit] ****
рдХрд▓ тАв (kal) (Urdu spelling ┌й┘ДтАО)
   1. yesterday
   2. tomorrow
   3. any indefinite time in the past or future
**** Noun[edit] ****
рдХрд▓ тАв (kal)┬аm (Urdu spelling ┌й┘ДтАО)
   1. yesterday
            рдХрд▓ рдХреА рд░рд╛рдд тАХ kal k─л r─Бt тАХ last night; tomorrow night
   2. tomorrow
            рдХрд▓ рдХреА рд░рд╛рдд тАХ kal k─л r─Бt тАХ last night; tomorrow night
   3. any indefinite time in the past or future
*** Usage notes[edit] ***
    * Whether the word рдХрд▓ means either yesterday or tomorrow is generally
      clarified by the tense of the verb. Since Hindi verbs conjugate for both
      the past and future tenses, it possible to know the precise meaning of
      the word just by looking at the verb tense. If a verb is not present, the
      meaning can be understood by context.

**** Adjective[edit] ****
рдХрд▓ тАв (kala)
   1. indistinct, dumb
   2. indistinct or inarticulate (on account of tears)
   3. low, soft (as a tone), emitting a soft tone, melodious (as a voice or
      throat)
   4. a kind of faulty pronunciation of vowels
   5. weak, crude, undigested

**** Noun[edit] ****
рдХрд▓ тАв (kala)┬аm
   1. a low or soft and inarticulate tone (as humming, buzzing etc.)
   2. Shorea_robusta, the shala_tree
   3. (poetry) time equal to four matras or instants
   4. (in the plural) a class of manes (clarification of this definition is
      needed)
